name: heat and power co-generation, lignite | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/16821/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity and district heat in an average combined heat and power lignite power plant. 'Lignite' is used as representant for 'brown coal', which includes sub-bituminous coal and lignite according to the definition of the IEA electricity information 2014. (IEA. 2014. Electricity Information 2014. ISBN 978-92-64-21692-1. International Energy Agency (IEA), Paris Cedex (FR).);;Comments on the inventory data of emissions: ; - for the assessment of main characteristics (sulphur and ash content of coal, efficiency of the plant) and CO2 a bottom-up approach has been used. It consists in the collection of information about single plants. ;- Halogene emissions have been estimated on the basis of the content of the species in the country-specific coal input mix, assuming average retention rates.  ; - For CO and particle emissions average values for the former UCTE are included (Union for the Coordination of the Transmission of Electricity, since 2009 replaced by ENTSO-E European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity).  ; - The country specific emissions of N2O depend on the share of DeNOx.  - Emissions of trace elements were calculated by means of a formula (CORINAIR) using the ash content in the country-specific coal input mix and average transfer coefficients for coal power plants, taking into account the share of DeSOx installed. ; - Emission of uranium and thorium radioactive isotopes were assumed proportional to the corresponding element emitted with particles; the other non-gaseous radioactive isotopes of the uranium and thorium decay chain were assumed proportional to the emitted U-238 or Th-232. ; - The emission of gaseous radon and K-40 are taken from the literature.;IEA. 2009. Coal information, 2009 edition. Documentation for beyond 2020 files. International Energy Agency.;European Environment Agency (1991) CORINAIR Inventory; VOC's Default Emission Factors

From the constructed lignite power plant ready to produce heat and electricity. 

From reception of lignite and operating materials at power plant gate. Functional unit is "1MJ of lignite input to combustion".

This activity ends with 1MJ of lignite in a combined heat and power power plant. 

This dataset includes: 
 - all operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants. 

 - Particle removal (dedusting of the flue gas)
  - Desulfurisation and denitrification. These processes are described in separate modules; it can be decided by changing the values of NOx and SOx retained whether and how much DeNOx and DeSOx are installed. 
 - Cooling: It is assumed that all plants use wet cooling with a cooling tower. No cooling tower is included in this dataset (will be implemented in future versions)
- Loss of feed water 
 - Losses from gross electricity production, e.g. for internal use


This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets
 - transformation of the electricity produced
 - The disposal of non-recycled ashes is modelled separately.
 - Use of fuel oil for startup, as this can be neglected for lignite power plants because these are run for a long time (2-3 years) without being shut down.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2012.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: POWER PLANT:;Lignite power plant input is a dataset which consists of a mix of 30% 100MW power plant and 70% 500MW power plant. The plants are used for basic load with 6000 hours of operation at full capacity per year. The plants are assumed to operate 200000 hours during its lifetime.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Most of the exchanges were extrapolated through production-weighted averages of the datasets of the following 10 countries: AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK.

exchanges.description: Electricity output per MJ of hard coal burned.

flow.name: electricity, high voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 10 countries 
(AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK) (Röder et al. 2007) 
Country emissions values calculated from trace element balance, input uncertain

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Uranium-238
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. At the moment, the lignite power plant input consists  of mix of a 100MWe power plant (30%) and a 500MWe power plant (70%). 
For this calculation, 6000 load hours per year are assumed. It is assumed that a total of 200'000h is reached during the lifetime. A capacity of 500MW is taken for the calculation.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 10 countries

flow.name: Mercury II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Weighted average from all figures from countries in ecoinvent version 2 (AT, FR, BA, BG, CS, CZ, DE, ES, GR, HU, MK, PL, RO, SI, SK) and the new countries for version 3 (AU, CA, ID, IN, RU, TH, TR, TW, UA). Weighting was made with net electricity production 2008 in these countries (Itten&Frischknecht 2012). According to Röder et al. 2007, about 20-60% of the sulfur contained in the coal don't turn into SO2 but can be found in the ash. A factor of 40% is taken into account here.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 10 countries 
(AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK) (Röder et al. 2007) 


Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Vanadium V
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Ash remaining when burning 1MJ of lignite. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and ash values 10 countries 
(AT, BA, CZ, DE, ES, FR, HU, PL, SI, SK). These values were valid for the ash being disposed off. Now, total amount of ash has been calculated (disposed+recycled) with the data in Tab. 9.69 p. 165 in Röder et al. 2007. Country ash values calculated from mass balance. Globally, 6% of the lignite ash are recycled, 94% go to disposal.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: lignite ash
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

defaultProvider.name: market for lignite ash | lignite ash | Cutoff, U
defaultProvider.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value. Cooling water, decarbonised, for the cooling water circuit lost when burning 1MJ of lignite. Röder et al. 2007, Tab. 9.65 and Tab. 9.66, p. 160f. These tables give an amount of 0.15 kg/MJ burned, which is valid for the assumption of 75% wet cooling and 25% run-through cooling. However, this revised dataset assumes 100% wet cooling.

flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

flow.name: Benzene
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Weighted average from all figures from countries in ecoinvent version 2 (AT, FR, BA, BG, CS, CZ, DE, ES, GR, HU, MK, PL, RO, SI, SK) and the new countries for version 3 (AU, CA, ID, IN, RU, TH, TR, TW, UA). Weighting was made with net electricity production 2008 in these countries (Itten&Frischknecht 2012).
